intro: Oritrophium aciculifolium, commonly known as the needleleaf composite, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its slender, needle-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the Asteraceae family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open habitats. Oritrophium aciculifolium is adapted to withstand drought and high sunlight exposure, making it a resilient species in its native range.
